subject: generating historical graph of test results
msgSnippet: Hi, I was just chatting with Mike Clark about my desire to save historical test JUnit results, and to have a way to generate a graph from them.  I m imagining
messageBody:
Hi, I was just chatting with Mike Clark about my desire to save
historical test JUnit results, and to have a way to generate a graph
from them. I'm imagining an ant target that would automatically build a
bar chart that shows the progress of test results over the course of a
project. The X axis would be time, maybe in 1 week increments. The Y
axis would be number of tests. And I'd have a stacked bar for each week
to show the total tests executed, broken down into pass/fail/error.
That way, management could look at the chart and see our progress on the
project from the perspective of tests (whether it's unit tests or system
tests that use JUnit) and feel happy. Later I might even add in code
coverage percentages for even more juicy goodness.

Has anyone else put something like this together? Mike mentioned he's
heard of others who want to build such a results graphing tool, but
didn't know if anyone's got one they're sharing. So I'm posting here,
looking for pointers.


Thanks in advance,
Todd.
----
Todd Bradley - Polycom - QA Lead, Super Secret Project
